decision_conditions: It is recommended that the following trees, Beech tree T1,Hornbeam T2 and Pear tree T3, on the plan of Havering's TPO 08/04 can be pruned. T1 beech tree can be overall crown reduced by up to 2m, and crown lifted 5m, T2 Hornbeam can be overall crown reduced by 2m and crown lifted by 5m and the Pear tree can be overall crown reduced by up to 1.5m.  This property is within the Gidea Park Conservation Area and the Magnolia tree can be overall crown reduced by up to 30%.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.
description:
-Beech tree T1 and Hornbeam T2 , crowns reduced and thinned through but to keep overall present shape.
- Pear tree T3 , crown reduced and thinned through but to keep present overall shape.
- Magnolia ,(NO TPO) top reduction and some lower branch removal in order to let light penetrate to beech hedge behind , as hedge is becoming very thin and is in danger of dying through lack of light
